param.name: tags
param.para: Tags for search the element. If the count of tags is more than one then they are through ";".

param.para: This parameter can take the following values​​: "text", "notext" and "regexp".

param.name: number

member.remarks: If html element was not found then this method returns the HtmlElement object in which IsVoid or IsNill property is "true".

member.name: T:ZennoLab.CommandCenter.Instance
member.summary: Represents a browser's window of ZennoPoster
member.remarks: The Instance class contain the properties such as ErrorDetected and IsVoid. Their use necessary for the correct work of your code.

example.para: The following example creates an Instance object and shows the uses of the object Tab class.
example.code:
<?php
            namespace System;
            namespace ZennoLab\CommandCenter;
             
            class Example
            {
                public static function Execute()
                {
                    // create a new Instance object
                    $instance = new Instance("127.0.0.1", 40500, "server");
                    
                    // clear cookie
                    $instance->ClearCookie();
                    
                    // clear cache
                    $instance->ClearCache();
                    
                    // go to zennolab.com
                    Tab tab = instance.MainTab;
                    if (tab.IsNull) return -1;
                    if (tab.IsVoid) return -1;
                    tab.Navigate("zennolab.com");
                    if (tab.IsBusy) tab.WaitDownloading();
                    
                    return 0;
                }
            }
            ?>

requirements.para: Target Platforms: Desktop: Windows XP SP3 and older. Server: Windows Server 2003 and older.

member.name: M:ZennoLab.CommandCenter.Instance.FindElementByIntelliSearch(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Searches for an HTML element using IntelliSearch technology, and returns the first or the most appropriate occurrence.

param.name: form
param.para: The form for searching. It's can be name on one of supported languages or id from current IntelliSearch base.

param.name: elementClass
param.para: The class of element for searching. It's can be name on one of supported languages or id from current IntelliSearch base.

param.name: isLink
param.para: The true if are searching html link; otherwise false. In case then isLink is true, parameter "form" can be empty. It's not error if "form" not empty, however this parameter is not used.

param.name: inBlocked
param.para: The true if allowed to search among the locked html elements; otherwise false.

remarks.para: The parameters form and elementClass can be name on one of supported languages or id from current IntelliSearch base. IntelliSearch not depend not on the language or the version of the program. IntelliSearch is a multi-language system. However, depends on the current versions of the standard base and additional base (user base). Currently supports two languages: English and Russian. Do not forget that before using IntelliSearch must choose one of the standard base. Also the name of a class of elements and forms may vary in different versions of the base. The case of strings does not matter.

The parameter isBlocked should use if need find html element which was used by IntelliSearch. After using of the element, IntelliSearch marks html element as a blocked and ignores it in followings searching. If need find element among all or among the blocked then isBlocked should be true; otherwise false.

returns.para: The element found by the search.

requirements.para: Target Platforms: Desktop: Windows XP SP3 and older. Server: Windows Server 2003 and older.

param.para: The position's longitude in decimal degrees.

param.name: accuracy
param.para: The accuracy of the latitude and longitude, expressed in meters.

param.name: altitude
param.para: The position's altitude in metres, relative to sea level. The default value is 0.

param.name: altitudeAccuracy
param.para: The accuracy of the altitude expressed in meters. The default value is 0.

param.name: heading
param.para: The direction in which the device is traveling. This value, specified in degrees, 0 degrees represents true north, and the direction is determined clockwise (which means that east is 90 degrees and west is 270 degrees). The default value is 0.

param.name: speed
param.para: The velocity of the device in meters per second. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:ZennoLab.CommandCenter.Instance.ChangeRequest(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Replaces data of browser request.

remarks.para: To find the request use regex "regexUrl". To replace data in the request body use collections "regexesForReplace" and "datasForReplace", the first collection contains regular expressions that will replace the original data with the corresponding elements from the second collection. The "regexesForReplace" and "datasForReplace" collections should has a same size, otherwise the method doesn't perform and set ErrorDetected to True.

param.name: regexUrl
param.para: The regex string to find the request url.

param.name: regexesForReplace
param.para: Collection of regexs to find data in the request body.

param.name: datasForReplace
param.para: Collection of strings to replace the relevant data.

param.name: allTime
param.para: The true if use this replacement all time; otherwise and default, false.

requirements.para: Target Platforms: Desktop: Windows XP SP3 and older. Server: Windows Server 2003 and older.

member.name: M:ZennoLab.CommandCenter.Instance.ChangeResponse(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Replaces data of browser response.

remarks.para: To find the response use regex "regexUrl". To replace data in the response body use collections "regexesForReplace" and "datasForReplace", the first collection contains regular expressions that will replace the original data with the corresponding elements from the second collection. The "regexesForReplace" and "datasForReplace" collections should has a same size, otherwise the method doesn't perform and set ErrorDetected to True.

param.name: regexUrl
param.para: The regex string to find the response url.

param.name: regexesForReplace
param.para: Collection of regexs to find data in the response body.

param.name: datasForReplace
param.para: Collection of strings to replace the relevant data.

param.name: allTime
param.para: The true if use this replacement all time; otherwise and default, false.

member.name: M:ZennoLab.CommandCenter.Tab.FindElementByAttribute(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)

member.overloads: Searches for an HTML element by the attribute, and returns the first occurrence.

param.name: tags
param.para: Tags for search the element. If the count of tags is more than one then they are through ";".

param.name: searchKind
param.para: This parameter can take the following values​​: "text", "notext" and "regexp".

param.name: number
param.para: The item number in a collection of matching items.

member.remarks: If html element was not found then this method returns the HtmlElement object in which IsVoid or IsNill property is "true".

param.name: searchKind
param.para: This parameter can take the following values​​: "text", "notext" and "regexp".

param.name: number
param.para: The document address. This can be a number represented as a string or special expression for selection the desired number. The expression is constructed by the rules of the range of values. For example: random1(1,12-15,35-end).

param.para: The FTP protocol. It can be "FTP", "sFTP", or "FTPs".

member.remarks: The parameter "name" can be directory name (for example: Folder) or directory path (for example: Folder\SubFolder). There are two ways specify the directory path. See example.

requirements.para: Target Platforms: Desktop: Windows XP SP3 and older. Server: Windows Server 2003 and older.

member.name: M:ZennoLab.CommandCenter.ZennoPoster.FtpChmode(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Changes the access mode of specified ftp item.

param.name: login
param.para: The login of the FTP server.

param.name: pass
param.para: The password of the FTP server.

param.name: proxy
param.para: The proxy string in format: login:pass@ip:port OR ip:port.

param.name: mode
param.para: The mode for specified item. This a string value can be empty, in this case the mode of item will be "000".

param.name: protocol
param.para: The FTP protocol. It can be "FTP", "sFTP", or "FTPs".

remarks.para: For changing mode on ftp server you should make sure that current server support the "SITE CHMOD" command otherwise, this operation can not be performed.

The specified item can be file or directory. In case if specified item is the directory, the mode will be changed only for this ftp item, all internal files and subdirectories will not change the mode.

requirements.para: Target Platforms: Desktop: Windows XP SP3 and older. Server: Windows Server 2003 and older.
